message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about data-to-text generation using neural methods, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a hierarchical latent structure and uses variational inference, which are common techniques in machine learning and deep learning, respectively. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions capturing inter-sentence coherence, which is a common problem in NLP, and uses planning to address this issue. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions using image data to generate text, which suggests that cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) could also be a relevant sub-category.
